SENT.plain: The authors have studied the bases of the clinical and CT diagnosis of cerebral arterial occlusion in children from a series of 16 cases
The sequential evolution of the CT appearance seems characteristic depending on the time elapsed since the onset
Contrast enhancement, concerns mainly the grey matter, is maximum during the second and third weeks and should be looked for during this period
Some data, including the angiographic aspect of "endarteritis" may suggest an infectious pathogeny
